modelChange.modelChangeComments: not yet implemented -- 2.0.0 ? -- may need some revision of this proposed new model in that plot-level embargoes may not be the only embargoes desired - project level or observation level embargoes may also be required.

modelChange.modelChangeName: Plant and Comm level,parent move to Status

attribute.attDefinition: Specifies a level in the taxonomic hierarcy that a class belongs.

The plantParent is a recursive key to the concept of the parent level in the classification hierarchy. For example if this plantConcept were at the genus level the plantParent would be the plantConcept that is the family level (or subfamily level).
The commLevel attribute specifies a level in the taxonomic hierarcy to which a class belongs.

The commParent is a recursive key to the concept of the parent level in the classification hierarchy. For example, if this concept were at the association level, the parentClass would be a concept that is the parent alliance type.
A shorter, alternative Name that corresponds to plantName, perhaps lacking authority; an abbreviation.
Specifies a level in the taxonomic hierarcy that a class belongs.

The plantParent is a foreign key to the concept of the parent level in the classification hierarchy. For example if this plantConcept were at the genus level the plantParent would be the plantConcept that is the family level (or subfamily level).
The commLevel attribute specifies a level in the taxonomic hierarcy to which a class belongs.

The commParent is a foreign key to the concept of the parent level in the classification hierarchy. For example, if this concept were at the association level, the parentClass would be a concept that is the parent alliance type.

modelChange.modelChangeComments: Implemented in VegBank design, not fully functioning? -- see bug -- not implemented in VegBranch

attribute.attNotes: unique index on this field ; may be required in VegBank, not required in VegBranch
attribute.attDefinition: Unique string to identify an observation, according to the pattern: VB.obsSeqNumber -- to cite a plot one must also add the date of query: VB.obsSeqNumber.dateQueried

modelChange.modelChangeName: Revision track record additions and deletions

attribute.attDefinition: true indicates that this revision results from a newly inserted record.

attribute.attNotes: Tracking the data that was deleted gets problematic- how can it be reconstructed? It is possible that a new record will be inserted with the same PK as a deleted one, which is now stored here in the revision table; default = false
attribute.attDefinition: true indicates that this revision results from a deleted record.

modelChange.modelChangeName: Allow individual stems tracking in TaxonInterpretation; add stemHealth field to stemLocation to describe dead trees, perhaps other descriptions of health, too.

attribute.attDefinition: stemLocation record of a particular stem that is to be interpreted by this taxonInterpretation record.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: stem is dead
stem is uprooted, but still alive
stem leans in a non-trivial manner

attribute.attDefinition: Health of the stem referenced in this stemLocation record. Usually used to describe "dead" stems.

modelChange.modelChangeComments: a version 2.0.0 field.

attribute.attNotes: see Don F-L for values of closed list

modelChange.modelChangeComments: Not yet implemented - scheduled for 1.0.0beta2

attribute.attDefinition: Primary key for the reference table.
The 'shortName' field provides a concise or abbreviated name that describes the resource that is being documented.
Describes the type of reference this generic type is being used to represent. Examples: book, journal article, webpage.

The formal title given to the work by its author or publisher. The 'title' field provides a description of the resource that is being documented that is long enough to differentiate it from other similar resources.
A second, higher order title where appropriate, which in the case of a reference to a chapter is the Book title, and in the case of a Conference Presentation is the Name of the Conference.

The 'pubDate' field represents the date that the resource was published. The format should be represented as: CCYY, which represents a 4 digit year, or as CCYY-MM-DD, which denotes the full year, month, and day. Note that month and day are optional components. Formats must conform to ISO 8601. For example: 1999-10-26
The date the resource being referenced was accessed. This is useful if the resource is could be changed after formal publication, such as websites or databases.
The date the conference was held.
Foreign key into the journal table to identify the journal of this reference.
The volume field is used to describe the volume of the journal in which the article appears.
The issue field is used to describe the issue of the journal in which the article appears.
The page range field is used for the beginning and ending pages of the journal article that is being documented.
The total pages field is used to describe the total number of pages in the book that is being described.
The organization that physically put together the report and publishes it.
The location at which the work was published. This is usually the name of the city in which the publishing house produced the work.
The ISBN, or International Standard Book Number that has been assigned to this literature resource.
The edition field is to document the edition of the generic reference type that is being described.
Number of volumes in a collection
The chapter number of the chapter of a book that is being described.
The report number field is used to describe the unique identification number that has been issued by the report institution for the report being described.
The type of personal communication. Could be an email, letter, memo, transcript of conversation either hardcopy or online.
The degree field is used to describe the name or degree level for which the thesis was completed.
A URL (Uniform Resource Locator) from which this resource can be downloaded or additional information can be obtained.

A Digital Object Identifier - a digital identifier for any object of intellectual property. A DOI provides a means of persistently identifying a piece of intellectual property on a digital network and associating it with related current data. (www.doi.org)
This field provides any information that is not characterized by the other resource metadata fields. Example: Copyright 2001, Robert Warner
Primary key for the referenceAlternateIdentifier table.
Foreign key into the reference table to indicate which reference is referenced by this alternate identifier.

The data management system within which an identifier is in scope and therefore unique. This is typically a URL (Uniform Resource Locator) that indicates a data management system. All identifiers that share a system must be unique. In other words, if the same identifier is used in two locations with identical systems, then by definition the objects at which they point are in fact the same object. Example(s): http://metacat.somewhere.org/svc/mc/

An additional, secondary identifier for this entity. The primary identifier belongs in the reference table, but additional identifiers that are used to label this entity, possibly from different data management systems, can be listed here. Example: VCR3465
Primary key for the referenceContributor table.
Foreign key into the reference table to indicate which reference is referenced by this alternate identifier.
Foreign key into the referenceParty table to indicate which person contributed.
Use this field to describe the role the party played with respect to the resource. Some potential roles include technician, reviewer, principal investigator, and many others.
Numerical order in which this contributor's name should be in the order of contributors, if applicable. Examples: 1 [for the first author], 2, [for the second author], etc.
Primary key for the referenceParty table.
Type of Party this record refers to: usually person or institution. Type determines rules for which fields must be completed.

This field is intended to be used instead of a particular person or full organization name. If the associated person that holds the role changes frequently, then Position Name would be used for consistency. Note that this field, used in conjunction with 'organizationName' and 'individualName' make up a single logical originator. Because of this, an originator with only the individualName of 'Joe Smith' is NOT the same as an originator with the name of 'Joe Smith' and the organizationName of 'NSF'. Also, the positionName should not be used in conjunction with individualName unless only that individual at that position would be considered an originator for the data package. If a positionName is used in conjunction with an organizationName, then that implies that any person who currently occupies said positionName at organizationName is the originator of the data package. Example(s): Niwot Ridge Data Manager
The salutation field is used in addressing an individual with a particular title, such as Dr., Ms., Mrs., Mr., etc.

The given name field is used for the all names, except the surname, of the individual associated with the resource. Possible usages include: first name and middle name, first name and middle initials, first name, etc. Example(s): Jo, Jo R., Jo R.W., John Robert Peter
The surname field is used for the last name of the individual associated with the resource.
A suffix or suffix abbreviation that follows a name. Examples: Jr., Senior, III, etc.

The responsible party field contains the full name of the organization that is associated with the resource. This field is intended to describe which institution or overall organization is associated with the resource being described. Note that this field, used in conjunction with 'individualName' and 'positionName' make up a single logical originator. Because of this, an originator with only the individualName of 'Joe Smith' is NOT the same as an originator with the name of 'Joe Smith' and the organizationName of 'NSF'. Also, the positionName should not be used in conjunction with individualName unless only that individual at that position would be considered an originator for the data package. If a positionName is used in conjunction with an organizationName, then that implies that any person who currently occupies said positionName at organizationName is the originator of the data package. Example(s): National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis
Recursive Foreign key into the referenceParty table to indicate the current name of the party.
Primary key for the referenceJournal table.

The name of the journal, magazine, newspaper, zine, etc... in which the article was published. Example(s): Ecology, New York Times, Harper's, Canadian Journal of Botany/Revue Canadienne de Botanique ,The Journal of the American Medical Association
The ISSN, or International Standard Serial Number that has been assigned to this literature resource. Example(s): ISSN 1234-5679
Standard abbreviation or shorter name of the journal. Example(s): Can. J. Bot./Rev. Can. Bot., JAMA

modelChange.modelChangeComments: this field should be hidden from the user, as it is generated by VegBank as a summary of information available for this observation. Should also be changed to a numeric field from long varchar

attListItem.attListValueDesc: sufficient for determining type occurrence
sufficient for inclusion in a classification revision
fully compliant with recommendations

attribute.attDefinition: Quality of plot as determined by an automated filter system

modelChange.modelChangeName: observation.representativeness no longer has a list of values - is just a text field
modelChange.modelChangeComments: used to be a closed list, now is just an open text field. Should increase size of field to 250 characters.

attribute.attDefinition: How representative was the plot of the stand?

modelChange.modelChangeComments: geology was a closed list, but should be made an open list. The list of values is long and not needed here, therefore it is left out.

modelChange.modelChangeName: geology will be split into two fields, rockType and surficialDeposit
modelChange.modelChangeComments: details still on the way...
SoilTexture values will be somewhere between 12 and 21 standard values. Details still in process.
level will probably be an open list -- values will be added to include Braun-Blanquet values. May need to mimic coverMethod / coverIndex table structure.

the following fields are no longer required (nulls=no) : plot.confidentialityReason observation.taxonObservationArea plot.area observation.STRATUMMETHOD_ID observation.autoTaxonCover observation.coverDispersion observation.COVERMETHOD_ID
1 field needs adding necessary for Braun-Blanquet communities.

attribute.attDefinition: Typal plot for the Braun-Blanquet community name.

modelChange.modelChangeComments: additional name Systems are necessary for Braun-Blanquet communities.

attribute.attDefinition: true if this plot-commConcept link represents the typal plot for the Braun-Blanquet community name referenced by the commConcept.

modelChange.modelChangeComments: Some general metadata fields need adding - between the highly structured stratumMethod/ coverMethod and the very unstructured "narrative" fields.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: Each individual is assigned to one and only one stratum in which it most significantly occurs. Generally, this is the tallest stratum that the individual occupies.
Individuals are included in each stratum they occupy, allowing one individual to be assigned to multiple strata, if it crosses the height boundary between strata.

attribute.attDefinition: The way that an individual's cover is assigned to the different stratum. Some methodologies allow an individul to span multiple strata and have stratumCover values in each stratum. Other methodologies require that all cover from an individual be assigned to the upper-most stratum. Further information about the specifics of stratum Methodologies that deviate from the standard practice of the stratumMethod referened in the field stratumMethod_ID should be described in methodNarrative.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: every part of each plant is included in estimating cover
only foliage is included in estimating cover

attribute.attDefinition: The way that cover is estimated on the observation.

modelChange.modelChangeComments: need field to track when observations are added

attribute.attDefinition: Date that the observation was added to VegBank

modelChange.modelChangeName: add recursive key to taxonInterpretation for irregular taxa
modelChange.modelChangeComments: add several fields to taxInt: recursive key: corr (union, intersection), fit, confidence.

attribute.attNotes: recursive foreign key into the TaxonInterpretation table
attribute.attDefinition: Link to another TaxonInterpretation record which contains other plantConcepts which the Interpreter wishes to group, according to the field: groupType

modelChange.modelChangeName: Parallel taxonInterpreation to model after commClass model.
modelChange.modelChangeComments: kill TaxonInt, add TaxonClass, TaxonContrib, TaxonInterp.
adds voucher fields to taxonInterp

attribute.attNotes: foreign key into the Party table
attribute.attDefinition: Party who collected the voucher which was used to make this taxonInterpretation.
The Collector's identification code for the voucher.
Date on which the voucher was collected.

attribute.attNotes: foreign key into the Party table
attribute.attDefinition: Link to the Party which is the museum which archives the voucher.
Museum Code which identifies the voucher.

modelChange.modelChangeName: add taxonAlt table to solve irregular taxa issue
modelChange.modelChangeComments: add new resolution table between taxonInterpretation and plantConcept to allow groups to be formed

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated number to uniquely identify this record, and thus taxonGroup.
Links to the taxonInterpretation for which several plantConcepts are grouped to form an irregular taxon. The plantConcept referenced here is one member of the group.
Links to the plantConcept that is part of the taxonGroup formed by all records in this table with the same taxonInterpretation_ID.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: (Fits well) No doubt about the match. Perfect fit.
(Absolutely doesn't fit) This answer is absolutely unacceptable. Unambiguously incorrect.
(Fits reasonably well) Good match with the concept. Unambiguously correct.
(Possibly fits) Maybe not the best possible answer but it is acceptable; this answer does not pose a problem to the user. Correct.

(Doesn't fit but is close) Not a good answer. There is something about the plot that makes the answer understandable, but there is clearly a better answer. This answer would pose a problem for users. Incorrect.

attribute.attDefinition: Indicates the degree of fit with the plant concept being assigned. Values derive from Gopal, S., and Woodcock, C. (1994), Theory and methods for accuracy assessment of thematic maps using fuzzy sets. Photogrammetric Engineering and Remote Sensing 60(2):181-188.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: The party making the taxon interpretation has a high confidence in the accuracy of this interpretation. A party can have high confidence that a plot has a fit of "absolutely wrong" for a particular community.
The party making the taxon interpretation has a low confidence in the accuracy of this interpretation.
The party making the taxon interpretation has a medium amount of confidence in the accuracy of this interpretation.

attribute.attDefinition: Indicates the degree of confidence of the interpretor(s) in the interpretation made. This can reflect the level of familiarity with the classification or the sufficiency of information about the plot (e.g., High, Moderate, Low).
notes about this taxonAlt assignment.

modelChange.modelChangeName: changes agreed on for dealing with irregular taxa
modelChange.modelChangeComments: add TaxonObs.authorPlantName, fit/confidence to taxonInterpretation

attribute.attDefinition: Plot Author's name of the plant used during the taxonObservation

attListItem.attListValueDesc: One of several plant concepts is interpreted to be the TaxonObservation in question. For example, this is either species A OR species B. Plants observed were one or the other, but not both, but which species cannot be determined.
Several plant concepts are grouped to describe this taxon. For example, taxonObservation applies to the union of both species A and species B. Plants observed were from both species.

attribute.attDefinition: The type of group to be formed by linking to groupInterpretation_ID.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: (Fits well) No doubt about the match. Perfect fit.
(Absolutely doesn't fit) This answer is absolutely unacceptable. Unambiguously incorrect.
(Fits reasonably well) Good match with the concept. Unambiguously correct.
(Possibly fits) Maybe not the best possible answer but it is acceptable; this answer does not pose a problem to the user. Correct.

(Doesn't fit but is close) Not a good answer. There is something about the plot that makes the answer understandable, but there is clearly a better answer. This answer would pose a problem for users. Incorrect.

attribute.attDefinition: Indicates the degree of fit with the plant concept being assigned. Values derive from Gopal, S., and Woodcock, C. (1994), Theory and methods for accuracy assessment of thematic maps using fuzzy sets. Photogrammetric Engineering and Remote Sensing 60(2):181-188.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: The party making the taxon interpretation has a high confidence in the accuracy of this interpretation. A party can have high confidence that a plot has a fit of "absolutely wrong" for a particular community.
The party making the taxon interpretation has a low confidence in the accuracy of this interpretation.
The party making the taxon interpretation has a medium amount of confidence in the accuracy of this interpretation.

attribute.attDefinition: Indicates the degree of confidence of the interpretor(s) in the interpretation made. This can reflect the level of familiarity with the classification or the sufficiency of information about the plot (e.g., High, Moderate, Low).

modelChange.modelChangeComments: add AccessionCode to concept/party/refernece

attribute.attDefinition: Code that uniquely references this record, allowing reference to this record for this version of this database. Better than a primary key, which is automatically generated by a database and not globally unique. VegBank Accession codes are only generated by VegBank, and therefore data integrity can be guaranteed, unlike with a primary key (number).

Code that uniquely references this record, allowing reference to this record for this version of this database. Better than a primary key, which is automatically generated by a database and not globally unique. VegBank Accession codes are only generated by VegBank, and therefore data integrity can be guaranteed, unlike with a primary key (number).

Code that uniquely references this record, allowing reference to this record for this version of this database. Better than a primary key, which is automatically generated by a database and not globally unique. VegBank Accession codes are only generated by VegBank, and therefore data integrity can be guaranteed, unlike with a primary key (number).

Code that uniquely references this record, allowing reference to this record for this version of this database. Better than a primary key, which is automatically generated by a database and not globally unique. VegBank Accession codes are only generated by VegBank, and therefore data integrity can be guaranteed, unlike with a primary key (number).

modelChange.modelChangeComments: add a full text field to reference which would contain either 1)the original text of the reference as presented to vegbank, such as from NatureSever, or 2) the concatenated fields string from the original parsed fields in VegBank which will often need displaying for users.

attribute.attDefinition: The full text of the reference to be used as a reference. This could either be the original reference as presented to VegBank where parsed reference fields were unavailable, or concatenated reference fields where the parsed format is entered into VegBank.

modelChange.modelChangeComments: field to describe total cover for an observation

attribute.attDefinition: The total cover, in percent, of all vegetation on the plot.

modelChange.modelChangeName: change taxonObs and stratumComposition, and add biomass as importance value
modelChange.modelChangeComments: allow stems to hook into strata, some importance values apply to whole plot, not one stratum. field to describe biomass measured or inferred about taxon. in g/m2

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated number which uniquely identifies this record of the table.
Foreign Key into the TaxonObservation table to link to the information about the taxon for which this importance value applies.

Foreign Key into the stratum table, if this record is limited to the importance of a taxon in one stratum. If null, all values in this record speak of the importance of the entire taxon across all strata.
Cover, in percent, of the taxon (potentially limitied to one stratum if stratum_ID has a value).
Total basal area of the species in m2/ha (potentially limitied to one stratum if stratum_ID has a value).
The biomass of the species in g/m2 (potentially limitied to one stratum if stratum_ID has a value).

attribute.attNotes: The area used to infer the importance values of the taxon, if not the same as observation.taxonInferenceArea.
attribute.attDefinition: This is the area in m2 used to infer the importance values in this record. Generally this should be equal to observation.taxonInferenceArea, but at times this area may be larger or smaller for a specific taxon.

entity.entitySummary: This table is intended to store information about the abundance of tree stems of a specific size.

attribute.attNotes: Foreign key into the taxonImportance table
attribute.attDefinition: Foreign key into the taxonImportance table, thereby associating a taxon identification with the tree stem(s).

entity.entitySummary: This table is intended to store information about the abundance of tree stems of a specific size.

attribute.attNotes: Foreign key into the taxonObservation table
attribute.attDefinition: Foreign key into the taxonObservation table, thereby associating a taxon identification with the tree stem(s).

entity.entitySummary: This table contains the author's determination of a taxon and the overall cover of that taxon.
entity.entityDescription: This table stores information about the original identification by the author of the plot and the taxonomic authority used by that author (i.e. a name - citation pair constituting a taxonomic concept). The table also contains a record of cumulative cover (cover across all strata) of the taxon when not divided into strata.

attribute.attDefinition: Specifics about the accession number and location of a collection made of the taxon
Overall cover of the taxon across all strata
Total basal area of the species in the stemInferenceArea in m2/ha
The taxon name that the author of the plot used to refer to a taxon observed within the plot.

entity.entitySummary: This table stores information about the cover of a single taxon within a specific stratum.

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated identifier assigned to each unique observation of a taxon in a stratum.

attribute.attNotes: Foreign key into the taxonObservation table, which identifies the taxon.
attribute.attDefinition: Link to the identification of the taxon being observed.

attribute.attNotes: Foreign key into the stratum table.
attribute.attDefinition: Link to the specific stratum in which the taxon occurs. Because a single taxon may occur in more than one stratum, this attribute has a many to one relationship with a single taxon observation.
Percent cover of taxon in stratum

modelChange.modelChangeName: change framework and put it in vegbank database
modelChange.modelChangeComments: puts user info and certification and all that in vegbank database

entity.entitySummary: Embargo of plot data.

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated unique key for each record in this table.
Foreign key to the plot to which this embargo applies.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: Plot Author requires that plot be embargoed
There are rare species on this plot whose exact location should not be revealed to all users.
Land owner requires plot data to be embargoed
The data pertaining to this plot have been determined to have errors.
None of the above reasons.

attribute.attDefinition: Reason why the plot is embargoed. This field, as all fields in this table, are private and cannot be viewed or downloaded by VegBank users.
Start date for the embargo.
Stop date for the embargo.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: Public
1 km radius
10 km radius
100 km radius
Location embargo
Public embargo on data
Full embargo on data

attribute.attDefinition: Level of embargo for users that do not have special permission found in userPermission table.

entity.entitySummary: Information about VegBank users.

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated unique key for each record in this table.
Foreign key pointing to the party that corresponds to this user. When the user makes changes to the database, the party referenced here will be recorded in VegBank.
Password to access VegBank on the web.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: Guest User - permission to view data
Registered User - can build datasets and store queries
Certified User - permission to load data: plots, plants, communities, metadata
Professional User - permission to annotate
Database Administrator - full privileges

attribute.attNotes: This list is also in 2 other fields!
attribute.attDefinition: Level of permission that the user has, corresponding to certification.
Date/time of first log-in.
Date/time of most recent log-in.
Number of times logged in.
Email address used to log on to VegBank on the web.

attribute.attNotes: name the user wishes to be called in correspondence
attribute.attDefinition: Name to be used in VegBank correspondance, generally just the given name. If blank, we will use the givenName found in party table.
IP address used to register the VegBank account.

entity.entitySummary: Info about user certification.

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated unique key for each record in this table.
Foreign key pointing to the user about which this certification request applies.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: Guest User - permission to view data
Registered User - can build datasets and store queries
Certified User - permission to load data: plots, plants, communities, metadata
Professional User - permission to annotate
Database Administrator - full privileges

attribute.attNotes: This list is also in 2 other fields!
attribute.attDefinition: Level of certification the user currently has.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: Guest User - permission to view data
Registered User - can build datasets and store queries
Certified User - permission to load data: plots, plants, communities, metadata
Professional User - permission to annotate
Database Administrator - full privileges

attribute.attNotes: This list is also in 2 other fields!
attribute.attDefinition: Level of certification the user is requesting in this record.
Highest degree attained by the user, thus far.
Year of highest Degree.
Institution granting Highest Degree
Current Institution the user works with or for.
Position within the Current Institution of the user.
User is a certified ESA ecologist?
Users documentation of their professional experience.
publications showing experience or expertise in fields relating to VegBank.
background and expertise in vegetation sampling
background and expertise with vegetation analysis, description and classification
prior experience with the US National Vegetation Classification, if any
prior experience with the VegBank archive, if any
what uses do you anticipate making the VegBank archive?
prior experience with other vegetation plot database and/or analytical tools
First ESA sponsor's name
First ESA sponsor's email.
Second ESA sponsor's name.
Second ESA sponsor's email.
User would like to participate in the peer review process.
Anything else the user would like to say about his/her certification request.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: User has requested certification, but nothing further is known
Certification panel has acknowledged receipt of certification request, but a decision has not yet been made.
Certification panel requests that the user demonstrate ability with VegBank before granting certification.
Certification panel grants certification on a temporary basis, the explanation of which should be in certificationStatusComments
Certification panel has certified this user.
Certification panel has decided that this user should not be certified.
Certification panel does not think that this is a serious request and does not respond to it (i.e. junk mail)

attribute.attDefinition: Status of the certification request: requested, pending, denied, approved
Comments about the certification status, i.e. more information

entity.entitySummary: Self assessment of regional experience for certified users.

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated unique key for each record in this table.
Foreign key into the userCertification table for which this regional experience assessment applies.
Region the user has experience with.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: weak knowledge
some knowledge
moderate knowledge
great knowledge
expert knowledge

attribute.attDefinition: Experience of the user with the Vegetation of this region.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: weak knowledge
some knowledge
moderate knowledge
great knowledge
expert knowledge

attribute.attDefinition: Experience of the user with the Floristics of this region.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: weak knowledge
some knowledge
moderate knowledge
great knowledge
expert knowledge

attribute.attDefinition: Experience of the user with the US-NVC or IVC of this region.

entity.entitySummary: User stored datasets

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated unique key for each record in this table.
Foreign key pointing to the user to whom this dataset belongs.
Date of start of dataset.
Date of end of dataset, if deemed no longer active.
Accession Code of the dataset, to be used to reference the observations contained here with a URL pointing to this dataset. Helps avoid URL's that are too long.
Name of Dataset, should be unique for each user.
Description of dataset.
Type of dataset.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: anyone can view this dataset - it is listed among public datasets
no one can view this dataset except the user who created it
no one may view this dataset except with a password, as specified in this table.

attribute.attDefinition: OK to share this dataset with others? Note that the dataset must be public or password-protected to be accessed via the accessionCode.
Password to access the dataset if the dataset is password protected.

entity.entitySummary: Items (entities) that belong to a user's dataset.

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated unique key for each record in this table.
Foreign key to the dataset in which the observation in this record is a member.

attribute.attNotes: accessionCode for observation that is part of dataset: used instead of observation_ID to allow observations from any database
attribute.attDefinition: Accession Code for the observation which is a member of the dataset referenced in userDataset_ID. Accession codes are used so that observations from any VegBank database can be included in the dataset.
Type of item/entity that this is.
Start date for the validity of this record.
Stop date for the validity of this record.
Notes about the observation as part of the dataset.

entity.entitySummary: User requests to be notified if certain criteria in VegBank change

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated unique key for each record in this table.
Foreign key pointing to the user to whom this notification request pertains.
Name of notification, included in emails to user.
Description of notification, which will be included in emails to user.
start of notifications.
stop date of notifications.
date of last check, assuming these requests will be processed through a cron-job.
SQL that returns whatever information the user would like to know. Preferably, these grab accession codes which would be easy to build hyperlinks to the info requested.

entity.entitySummary: Permission for user to see embargoed plot.

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated unique key for each record in this table.
Foreign key into the Embargo table that identifies which embargo this permission overrides.
Foreign key into the user table which identifies the user to whom this permission is granted.
Start date of permission
Stop date of permission

attListItem.attListValueDesc: Public
1 km radius
10 km radius
100 km radius
Location embargo
Public embargo on data
Full embargo on data

attribute.attDefinition: Status granted to the user for viewing.
Notes that the embargo owner may include with the permission.

entity.entitySummary: User stored queries.

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated unique key for each record in this table.
Foreign key to the user who created and owns this query.
Start date for query.
Stop date for query.
Accession Code used to see this query and its results.
Name of query, provided by user.
Description of query, provided by user.
SQL that identifies objects in question.

attribute.attNotes: plot query, plant query, party query, etc.
attribute.attDefinition: Type of query that this is - user specified.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: anyone can view this query- it is listed among public queries
no one can view this query except the user who created it
no one may view this query except with a password, as specified in this table.

attribute.attDefinition: type of sharing, if any allowed.
Password to access query, if query is password-protected.

entity.entitySummary: Generic table to store user Preferences.

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated unique key for each record in this table.
Foreign key pointing to the user whose preference this is.
Name of preference.
Value of the preference.

The priority rank of this preference if there are more than one preference with the same value. Useful if options are not always available. For example, the first rank priority could instruct VegBank to show plantConcept with common Name system. A second preference could specify that if the first pref is unavailable, use Scientitic Name.
start of notifications.
stop date of notifications.

entity.entitySummary: Information about what user owns what table records in vegbank

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated number to uniquely identify this row in this table.
Foreign key pointing to the user about which this ownership applies.
Name of the table that the ownsership is associated with.
The record number (row) containing the value with which the ownership is associated (which translates to the primary key value for the table wherein the record is stored).
Date the record in question was created in VegBank. This could be different from OwnerStart if ownership was transferred to another user.
Start date of the ownership of the record specified.
Stop date of the ownership of the record specified.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: full ownership of record
incomplete ownership of record, privileges are limited

attribute.attDefinition: The degree of control the owner has over the record in question.

modelChange.modelChangeName: consolodate party tables into one party table
modelChange.modelChangeComments: removed plantParty and commParty and points tables that depended on those to Party. Best done with search and replace of commParty to party and plantParty to party in the schema file.

entity.entitySummary: This table store the status of a community concept as perceived by a party at a time.

attribute.attDefinition: Foreign key that identifies the party that made the status assignment

entity.entitySummary: This table links a community name with a concept.

attribute.attDefinition: Foreign key that identifies the party that used the class concept with the name.

attribute.attDefinition: Foreign key that identifies the party that uses the concept with the name.

attribute.attDefinition: Foreign key that identifies the party that made the status assignment

entity.entitySummary: This table links a community name with a concept.

attribute.attDefinition: Foreign key that identifies the party that used the class concept with the name.

attribute.attDefinition: Foreign key that identifies the party that made the status assignment

entity.entitySummary: This table links a plant name with a concept.

attribute.attDefinition: Foreign key that identifies the party that uses the concept with the name.

entity.entitySummary: Party contributing plant taxonomic perspective; may be either an individual or an organization.

attribute.attNotes: Primary key for the party table.
attribute.attDefinition: Database generated identifier assigned to each unique party.
Salutation preceding one's given name.
One's first name.
One's middle name or initial, if any.
Name shared in common to identify the members of a family, as distinguished from each member's given name.
Name of an organization.
Recursive foreign key to current name of this party.
Instructions for contacting a party.
Recursive foreign key to the Party who owns this party record and who has exclusive rights to update the information content.

entity.entitySummary: Party contributing community taxonomic perspective; may be either an individual or an organization.

attribute.attNotes: Primary key for the party table.
attribute.attDefinition: Database generated identifier assigned to each unique party.
Salutation preceding one's given name.
One's first name.
One's middle name or initial, if any.
Name shared in common to identify the members of a family, as distinguished from each member's given name.
Name of an organization.
Recursive foreign key to current name of this party.
Instructions for contacting a party.
Recursive foreign key to the Party who owns this party record and who has exclusive rights to update the information content.

modelChange.modelChangeName: add partyMember and partyType so that parties have types and can have sub-parties
modelChange.modelChangeComments: to facilitate teams or other non-standard parties

entity.entitySummary: Party contributing to collection or interpretation of a plot; may be either an individual or an organization.

attListItem.attListValueDesc: a person
a group of persons, but not a whole organization
an entire organization
a group of organizations

attribute.attDefinition: The type of party this is.

entity.entitySummary: Allows parties to contain other parties within them, so that the children parties can have permissions of the parent parties.

attribute.attDefinition: Database generated number to uniquely identify this record of this table.
Link to the parent party to whom the child party here belongs.
Link to the child party who belongs to the parent listed in parentParty_ID.
Link to the role which defines the child's role in the parent party.
Start date for the child's membership in the parent party.
Stop date for the child's membership in the parent party.

entity.entitySummary: Party contributing to collection or interpretation of a plot; may be either an individual or an organization.

attribute.attDefinition: Recursive foreign key to the Party who owns this party record and who has exclusive rights to update the information content.

modelChange.modelChangeComments: drop and add back the field

entity.entitySummary: This table stores general, constant information about the a given plot
entity.entityDescription: plot contains Plot location, dimension, and similarly constant site data, plus metadata that need be stored only once. Transient observational information (procured during the first or subsequent observation events) are stored separately in observation or its children.

attribute.attDefinition: Text description of and the rationale for the layout of the plot.

entity.entitySummary: This table stores general, constant information about the a given plot
entity.entityDescription: plot contains Plot location, dimension, and similarly constant site data, plus metadata that need be stored only once. Transient observational information (procured during the first or subsequent observation events) are stored separately in observation or its children.

attribute.attDefinition: Text description of and the rationale for the layout of the plot.

modelChange.modelChangeComments: alter some soilObs fields. add value to closed list and change length of field.

entity.entitySummary: This table stores observation on soil horizons made during the plot observation event.
entity.entityDescription: soilObs is child of observation in recognition of the fact that the horizons observed vary among plot observation events as a results of real change plus changes in investigators, methods and circumstances.

attribute.attDefinition: The horizon to which this observation applies.

entity.entitySummary: This table stores observation on soil horizons made during the plot observation event.
entity.entityDescription: soilObs is child of observation in recognition of the fact that the horizons observed vary among plot observation events as a results of real change plus changes in investigators, methods and circumstances.

attribute.attDefinition: Code that uniquely references this record, allowing reference to this record for this version of this database. Better than a primary key, which is automatically generated by a database and not globally unique. VegBank Accession codes are only generated by VegBank, and therefore data integrity can be guaranteed, unlike with a primary key (number).

entity.entitySummary: This table stores general, constant information about the a given plot
entity.entityDescription: plot contains Plot location, dimension, and similarly constant site data, plus metadata that need be stored only once. Transient observational information (procured during the first or subsequent observation events) are stored separately in observation or its children.

entity.entitySummary: This table stores plot observation results that might vary between official observation events.
entity.entityDescription: Observation is a child of plot in recognition of the fact that a plot may be re-sampled and that some of the environmental conditions may change between resampling events.

attribute.attDefinition: Accession code that uniquely identifies this observation publicly.

modelChange.modelChangeName: avoid use of SQL reserved words
modelChange.modelChangeComments: plot.state, projContrib.role, definedValue.value all get renamed

entity.entitySummary: This table stores information about a party contributing to a project.
entity.entityDescription: This table serves as an intersection entity used to 'link' a party with a specific project wherein vegetation plots are described.

entity.entitySummary: This table stores general, constant information about the a given plot
entity.entityDescription: plot contains Plot location, dimension, and similarly constant site data, plus metadata that need be stored only once. Transient observational information (procured during the first or subsequent observation events) are stored separately in observation or its children.

attribute.attDefinition: State or Province where the plot is located.

entity.entitySummary: This table stores the values of user-defined variables.
entity.entityDescription: This table stores values associated with specific user-defined variables identified in the userDefined table.

attribute.attDefinition: The value of the user-defined variable.

entity.entitySummary: This table stores the values of user-defined variables.
entity.entityDescription: This table stores values associated with specific user-defined variables identified in the userDefined table.

modelChange.modelChangeComments: notelink.attribute = nulls ok.

entity.entitySummary: This table links a note made by a database user or manager to a specific table, record and attribute in the database.
entity.entityDescription: This table was developed with the goal of keeping all the notes associated with the plots in a single table rather than distributed in many tables across the database.

attribute.attDefinition: Name of the attribute in the table (stored in tableName) that the note is associated with.
